caption: It's a nice restaurant.
The pasta is fantastic. The wait staff at Lavagna is why I keep coming back though. Always in a great mood and they elevate your experience here.
Great food
The service was excellent, and the food was outstanding!!

We had such an amazing time celebrating a birthday a Lavagna. It's a hidden, reasonably priced gem in the Eastern Market area. Everyone loved the calamari and their homemade pasta. They went out of their way to make it special. They were very professional with social distancing. Half price bottles on Wednesdays are also a great bonus. We've eaten there several times before, and will continue to do so.
Really good service, really good food.
Great service and can't beat half price wines on Wednesday.
(Translated by Google) Food is delicious  (Original) La comida es deliciosa
Food is amazing! Haven't had anything bad here! Excellent service too!
Servings were small. Food was okay
only been here for brunch on sundays, but the food is good and the drinks are amazing. you can take the family there but more suited for adults.
Amazing food and very friendly service. Make a reservation!

Pizza was very delicious with a generous amount of pepperonis. I appreciate the fact that I was updated with the status of my pizza via text and emailed after I signed up with their account. The price was appropriate for the GIGANTIC pizza I ordered. Definitely coming back.  Thanks
Food was amazing! A little pricey but they have a great happy hour

We came here for my sister-in-law's 40th birthday brunch. I had the chicken and waffles and my wife had the biscuits and gravy minus the eggs. Both of our meals were good.  What impressed me the most is how well they handled a large party. We had 14 or 15 guests and everything was served promptly, bottomless mimosas were refilled frequently, and our orders came out timely and accurately. I would recommend this place for  large parties.
Food was good, though not extraordinary.  It was very loud which made our book club discussion difficult.  Service was good.
Consistently good food and a cozy atmosphere. A neighborhood go-to with authentic pasta and homemade flavored vodka.

I was really happy with this place. Our pastas came out in like two minutes, I'm not exaggerating, and that straight up scared my friend and I. I have no idea how they did it, but them noods were al dente and the pasta was really quite good. My friend got pesto, which I knew from the beginning is what I should have done. Fortunately he wasn't that hungry, so I got pappardelle with lamb and somma his pesto. Winner!
Best omelettes and service in town! And the mimosas are definitely a plus. Favorite local spot!
Great staff and impeccable food! I HIGHLY recommend! ♥️
My friends and I enjoyed our meal here during Restaurant Week! Each of our entrees was delicious and we even brought my friends 7 year old son, who is able to order pasta from the kids menu!
Delicious pasta..
Delicious food. The calamari wasn't my favorite, but I think I that was just preference. The salad and pasta was so good though.
Really understated but really yummy. Hand made Italian in a great neighborhood favorite ambience

overall food was great, it was fantastic to be back home again in the east coast, place a little loud but that speaks volumes on how popular the place is. my family and I will be back. thank you for everything.
Great brunch location and the bottomless mimosas were never empty.
Good food. Great calamari.  Cheesecake great also.

I really liked this place and the service! My boo and I thought we'd try a new place for dinner and came away pretty impressed. Our server Chandler was awesome, he was funny and attentive. The food was fresh and flavorful and my cocktail was tasty. I'll be back.
Eggs Florentine for brunch was fantastic.
Loved it! Romantic and great food
Waiter was super kind and comped a salad we didn't care for, and the food was good! Beware asking for just pesto as a sauce substitute though, they're a bit liberal with it.
Amazing
Great brunch!
Delicious brunch with sous vide eggs. What a treat.

The house made pasta is certainly delicous, and a simple menu provides enough variety to please many different people without being overwhelming. Traditional italian cuisine without any real special flair, provides the classic comfort food feel while still feeling upscale enough to justify the price tag. I had the Ravioli, and the edges of the pasta were a bit tough to chew, making me feel like the fresh ravioli was perhaps not quite as fresh as is advertised. The service was slow and our waiter seemed a bit confused at times. Sausage was a bit over salted, allowing the flavor of the salt to begin to overwhelm the sauces.

I really have to give this place 5 stars because the food was amazing. Everything is fresh from scratch and you can see and taste the quality. I got the homemade ricotta ravioli with  bolognese marinara and pizza was looking for the salt shaker before I started eating like I’m used to but I did not need it. At all. For anything. Everything was perfectly seasoned and properly presented. My wife got a broiled chicken dish with caramelized brussels and a wonderful polenta which was so light and delicious , I kept stealing bites! Didn’t have room for desserts but can only imagine the quality. I would go to DC again just for this place. Well, almost! Very good choice. Oh, only downside is getting panhandled while trying to dine outside. Definitely a turnoff.
Their only flaw is that they take themselves a bit too seriously. But that is more than made up by the quality and tastiness of the food.
Fresh pasta, great wine selection, always good service. Brunch is very good as well. I've never had a dish I didn't like. Outdoor seating if you don't mind waiting at peak times.
Highly recommend this place.  Service was excellent.  Food was even better.  The spaghetti shrimp is extremely tasty. Try the brussel sprout side dish.
Pretty mediocre for the price. I went for dinner but I've heard good things about brunch

If I could give 10 stars I would. I have been many times during brunch and dinner. Each visit is met with excellent service and they even have bug spray if you sit outside during the summer. The BEST fresh pasta and a wonderful atmosphere. I recommend making a reservation. One of the best places to eat on the Hill and DC!
Our favorite place for brunch, the menu is small but thoughtful and it's great food

Absolutely tragic restaurant that has made me vow to never eat out in an Italian restaurant ever again.  The flavors just fall flat. The bruschetta was a sad excuse of an appetizer that tasted like soggy crackers and sickly sweet onion. The spaghetti tastes closer to processed mac and cheese than actual pasta. I actually got sick afterwards. You couldn't pay me to eat here.

Bruschetta was an absolute nightmare. Overpowering sweet onion and cherry tomatoes cut in half on a piece of rock hard bread. Service was good as the waiter removed the bruschetta from my cheque. Pasta was pretty meh. Not obviously hand made or of any noticeable quality. Wouldn’t recommend for the  price.
Super chic and awesome! The ambience and food all reminds me of Italy. Loved it! The brunch is one of the best I have had in DC.
Get the Bolognese!!!
Amazing food!
Brunch was out outstanding A++
Thoroughly 'okay'
Truly bottomless mimosas for $15 (90 min)
Awesome food. Awesome service. Perfect atmosphere.
I keep going back. As a Sicilian, this is my go to for real Italian food. Hand made pasta, scratch ingredients. AND locally sourced. It's the best! Well worth the price!
Too expensive and serving sizes too small. Not a great combination.

Our first stop of the week and it didn't disappoint. Classic Italian offerings so just pick your favorite. Pair your favorite red wine with a fresh pasta dish, sit outside at a table, and watch the neighbors.
Great service and fantastic food. Bottomless is also worth the price.
Very knowledgeable regarding gluten allergy. They were able to swap out parts of my meal that could be subject to cross contamination. Food itself was delicious.
Really good hand made pasta
Lavagna is a perfect restaurant for a casual dinner or a fancy celebration. Food is great, service is great, atmosphere is cozy. Definitely a gem in Cap Hill/Barracks Row.
A must visit in DC!! Food, service and atmosphere were brilliant!!
Great brunch. Can accommodate larger parties, though you may have to wait. The Nutella Mascarpone is a must try!
This is some of the best Italian I've ever had. Def recommend the charcuterie!
.Farm to table! Carbonara was fantastic

Lavagna is an excellent place to go for brunch with kids. The service is 10/10 Mario our server has been the best server we've had in Washington DC in a couple of months, very attentive. Brunch here is very popular so make reservations. MIMOSAS WOW! If you're a mimosa lover come here! Wife was very happy with the Mother's Day Brunch.
Great food, Shakey service
Touristy.
Okay service and solid food. Not the best brunch I've had, but a nice place for solid food and good atmosphere. Would take people back
First time here.. stopped by for a quick dinner and just loved the pasta! (w/shrimp). Friendly service & their namesake cocktail was delicious (too bad I had to drive or I would of had 2)

Awesome italian food! I had never heard of this place before and came across it on Google Maps. So glad I did! We went with a group of 6 of us the first time and it was fantastic. It has enough options for everyone and the wine is rather cheap! The feel inside is very homey and the staff really knows their stuff. Nothing beats home made pasta!!

We came here for bottomless mimosa and the service was exceptional. Our waiter made sure our glasses were never empty! We ordered the spaghetti carbonara and the lobster risotto. The spaghetti is okay but the lobster risotto is very tasty and definitely worth a try.

Lavagna is a great place for brunch, at least that's why I go. Hosting indoor, upstairs, and a small outdoor seating area their all you can drink mimosas for $15 (with purchase of Entree.) They do not skimp on pours and ensure you get your monies worth. I've been several times and have referred many friends here who are new to the area!
Bottomless mimosas are a must. In a cute part of eastern market and their choices for brunch are great. Both healthy and good for hangovers.
Really great the boloGese
The pasta is AMAZING, and you get free bread to make it really feel like carb heaven. Do yourself a favor and check it out.

The ambiance and food here was good! I had the duck breast with beans and potatoes. The duck was cooked perfectly! The only thing is the service is slow at times, but the our waiter was attentive to our needs
Fantastic!

Lavagna has delicious home-made gluten free pasta! I have celiacs and did not have a reaction, so if you are gf and looking for some incredible pasta with even better bolognese, definitely go to Lavanga.
I love the Ravioli Ricotta (vegetarian style)!
Amazing service, great atmosphere, the best food I've had in D.C.
Good food and nice space to host private events
(Translated by Google) The attention was good, and the price not so expensive  (Original) Fue buena la atención, y el precio no tan caro
Delicious food and amazing service.
Amazing food! Everything was absolutely delicious.
Amazing fresh pastas.  Excellent staff. Mario is the best.  great spot for dinner
Delicious and flavorful.. Nice neighborhood vibe.
Good was the food. I will be there again and it was tasty food. Get the toast please. Apple butter was the best ever

(Translated by Google) It is a restaurant that is in the center of Washington DC, near Smithsonian Museum and Lincoln Memorial, they serve Italian food, good wine, nice atmosphere to enjoy with your partner or friends.  (Original) Es un restaurante que está en el centro de Washington DC, cerca de Smithsonian Museum y Lincoln Memorial, sirven comida italiana, buen vino, ambiente bonito para disfrutar con pareja o amigos.
Great apple jelly

First time I came here I didn’t love it, but my second experience was much better. Asked for the pasta primavera with cream sauce instead of marinara. Excellent. The pork belly with polenta appetizer was also delicious. Great waitress and good wine!

They accommodated our large group of crazy people. The food was awesome (sausage gravy YUM). They made sure my bottomless mimosa cup was never empty. In fact, they were so stealthy I only realized they had been refilling my cup when it started going to my head. There should be lines of millenials clamoring to get in, but other than my group it was quiet that day. Maybe I shouldn't give the secret away...
very good italian food with a lot of flavor
Good food from local farms.  Sundays are half price bottles of wine as well
My friends and husband liked their pasta. I thought mine [radiatore primavera] was too plain.
The sausage gravy with biscuit and eggs was delicious
Great food!!!  Great service!!

I got the spaghetti Bolognese and it was delicious. From the pictures It looked pretty fancy so I was a little anxious going to a work dinner with my 8 month old but they have high chairs and the staff was so friendly. One waitress even played peekaboo with my son. The food was delicious. I would definitely recommend this to a friend and return to eat there.
Awesome!
Amazing pasta, lovely wait staff, quiet atmosphere, good wine selection.  Don't miss this place
Highly recommend their mussels and pasta. Cozy atmosphere for a date and glass of wine.
Food is good. The service was difficult at times but the hostess totally saved the day.
Outstanding service!

Truly delcious Italian food in Barracks Row, with farm-to-table aesthetic. Awesome service from Joyce and the most amazing barback/busboy/man about town in Willie. Those two were amazing.  Focaccia was perfect and the wine list reasonable. Bolognese sauce had just the right blend of savory meat softened with a little milk with perfectly al dente pasta. Rack of lamb a touch underdone but mitigated by the perfect polenta smoothed with mascarpone.  Will definitely return for great food and service.

Food and service were very good. Everything was really good but there were a few of the finer details missing. I got the duck dish, which came with undercooked chunks of butternut squash. They basically did nothing with them. The duck was very good but wasn’t great. Cocktails were some of the best prices I’ve seen in DC. They were only 10-11 dollars when most places charge at least 14.
Service was good as was the food.
Outstanding Italian food/great atmosphere & pasta is fresh & amazing
Meh
Chandler's warm, attentive service was a highlight of our weekend,  thank you!!  Everything we ordered was delicious- it was the perfect birthday luncheon!
Great appetizers. Owners contribute to local charities so we love Lavagna even more!
Very good Italian food for a reasonable price in the DC area.
2nd time here, there will be more
This is a great little Italian restaurant. Have been going there for 6 years and it has never disappointed.
Went here for restaurant week, for sure coming back.

(Translated by Google) As soon as we arrived, we were informed about the kitchen, which would close in 15 minutes, and we were supported in ordering quickly. Both the strawberry salad with Gorgonzola and the homemade spaghetti Bolognese were awesome, just great! The portioning could have been a bit bigger. From the first three desserts offered, only two were still available, as we had to change the choice later, this was offered by the house. Top gesture! Generally very friendly staff and hospitable atmosphere.  (Original) Wir wurden gleich bei Ankunft über die in 15min schliessende Küche informiert und beim schnellen Bestellen unterstützt. Sowohl der Strawberry-Salat mit Gorgonzola wie auch die hausgemachten Spaghetti Bolognese waren der Hammer, einfach top! Die Portionierung hätte etwas grösser ausfallen dürfen. Von zuerst drei angebotenen Desserts waren nur noch zwei verfügbar, da wir die Wahl dadurch später wechseln mussten, wurde dieser vom Haus offeriert. Top Geste! Generell sehr freundliches Personal und gastfreundliche Atmosphäre.

(Translated by Google) Italian restaurant in a nice area of ​​the city. Quite contained menu but the few proposals are absolutely noteworthy. Pasta also gluten free. The kitchen closes early, probably in line with local habits.  (Original) Ristorante italiano in una bella zona della città.  Menù abbastanza contenuto ma le poche proposte sono assolutamente degne di nota.  Pasta anche gluten free.  La cucina chiude presto, probabilmente in linea con le abitudini del luogo.
Ok good, very pricey menu has few options.
Great food

Awesome brunch for an awesome price. It was so good I felt bad just sitting there drinking bottomless mimosas for a couple of hours.  The waiter was great, too. He reassured us that sitting there drinking and not ordering anything else is perfectly okay.
Great brunch options and $13 bottomless mimosas.

I come here with often and the good is always the same quality. Brunch has gotten popular over the years, you'll have to call ahead and make reservations just in case. For brunch, I always get the carbonara or sausage biscuit gravy. I love the wine selection when I get dinner there. The pasta is made in house which makes a huge difference. I've tried almost everything on the menu :).
Outstanding! Quaint space with terrific service. Nice wine selection and delicious food. The Spaghetti Bolognese was perfect. Hand made pasta and all farm to table dishes. This place is a gem!
Great food that's locally sourced!
Fresh everything. Food was flavorful and well presented. Very intimate ambiance. Moderately priced....definitely have a house drink.

Overall this place is good. Food is tasty although both the calamari and my pappardelle with lamb dish were a little on the salty side. Our server was polite, attentive and offered good recommendations.

username: Great video i agree with everything he says. Ritter

caption: Food was delish
Probably my favorite restaurant in all of DC. Consistently great food, half off bottles of wine every Sunday and Tuesday, and super a friendly wait-staff. Highly recommended!

Excellent Italian restaurant, with farm sourced (farm to table) meals.  They list all the sourcing forms over the hostesses station at the front door.  The food was prepared well the spaghetti was Al Dente and the flavor was marvelous. The appetizers were really nice and the portions were a good size, without being overwhelming. I also have to commend the wait staff, for being attentive, prompt, and knowing the menu very well - especially the wine list.  At the time of this review there is a half-price wine special for Sunday night. we were there to celebrate a birthday dinner and the staff even brought out a dessert with candles. This is clearly not trendy or elitist like some of the nearby restaurants which have insane waitlist and even more insane pricing.  For a restaurant of this caliber in Eastern Market I felt it was really comfortable, clean, and well put-together.  Nicely done!
Delicious pasta, good wine selection, excellent cheese and meat selection
Delicious. Friendly staff and tasty food. Well priced overall, especially if you are there for half priced wine night.
Lovely cafe. Fresh delicious food, attentive wait staff, nice wine selection. When I am in the area again, I will return.
Food was delicious
Great service, breakfast was really good
Attended a 40th Birthday party here and the food was AMAZING! Loved dining family style and the staff was very friendly as well. Highly recommend!!!
Awesome brunch! Great service.
Bellinis were good, crab rissoto was fantastic so we're the biscuits and gravy.  Sausage patties were a little dry but that's my only complaint

As always, consistently great food, excellent service and never an empty glass during our bottomless mimosa brunch.  Whether dinner or brunch with friends/family Lavagna is dependable & always on point.

Great from beginning to end.  Cheese and salami starter plate was one of the best and pasta dishes were liked by everyone in the group as well.  Tiramisu was a great ending.  1/2 price wine was nice too!  Service was great and friendly by everyone from waitress to bus boys and the rest.  Nice evening! Thanks.
Service was decent food was good, but quantity was lacking
Amazing fresh pasta!
Food was amazing, waitress was knowledgeable and very nice. Definitely in the expensive realm but worth it.
delicious as always. try the veal.
I met the nicest bartender but I didnt caught her name, but she made suggestions on what to eat and drink, she was so awesome
Great Food... GREAT brunch... Nice staff, good happy hour.  Mario at the bar is a good guy.   Go today, you won't be sorry.
Gotta try the Chance the Grappa drink.
Overall the food was good, but we have never seen such an unfriendly staff before.
Amazing service amazing food!!
One of the best brunches I've ever had!

Came here for brunch and really loved the sausage gravy biscuit dish that I ordered. The rest of the food at my table looked good too (the salmon omelet was HUGE).  -1 star for poor service, granted it was during a busy weekend brunch hour.

We know good food and this...was NOT.   We ordered what they referred to as bruschetta they have redefined it.  These were 3 thin ladyfingers sized pieces of hard toast with no flavor some cold caramelized onion and half of a cherry tomatoes on top.   We had the shrimp pasta which was flavorless.  I am not a big salt person but when cooking it is considered a seasoning and should be used in moderation.   Not using salt at all leaves food flavorless.   This food had no flavor to speak of.  To try and cheer my tastebuds up I order their cappuccino and tiramisu.  The coffee was GREAT I will give them that.  The tiramisu on the other hand was not.  The filling tasted more like cool whip and the cake not lady fingers was not flavored with coffee.  Not recommending this place to my friends.
Papardelle Lamb is GREAT!
Awesome dinner and brunch.  The staff goes over the top to make sure you are happy.
Good service. Intimate. Homey. Could hear each other.
Great food and ambiance
Just okay

I can't say that I cared for this place at all, the food was ok nothing special..  The drinks have to be some of the worse I've ever had in my life, the manager came by but nothing to make us feel like coming back. And then expected us to pay for drinks that we didn't drink the worse.. I would never recommend this place
The decor and atmosphere on the inside leave something to be desired. But I instantly forgot about that when I had my raviolis stuffed with sunny side eggs. Marvelous.

This is a wonderful quaint little place.  We had reservations and the place filled up shortly after it opened so I would recommend making them especially for brunch.  They have house made limoncellos and variations using different fruit, …

Love their weekend brunch. The sausage is SO GOOD! Can be noisy inside, but the outdoor patio is very nice when the weather allows. Very friendly staff and food is prepared nicely. Mario is best, you know!
Service was *really* good. Everything else wasn’t. The bruschetta wasn’t even bruschetta (see photo). Medium rare steak was served well done. Bolognese wasn’t bolognese. Go to Aqua Al 2 instead.
Very good place always delish

Fantastic venue to see a live show. Quaint, old style theatre seating, not too small and not too big, just right! The Goldilocks of live music venues! No pressure to buy food or drinks like some places. WARNING: you will smell like popcorn when you leave but it's worth it. Will definitely come back when a good live music performer is here.
Great foods in a comfortable atmosphere.
Great food and drinks. The service was excellent. Everything fresh and from area farms.
Made a reservation on a super busy Saturday and only had to wait 10 minutes to be seated. Staff were very accommodating and the food was quite delicious.
The service was outstanding.  The food was good but nothing out of the ordinary.  The pesto, bruschetta, and tiramisu were the bright points of the meal.  The radiatore was disappointing.
Overpriced for the food and atmosphere you get.

I'm really bad at trying new places but I'm so glad I found this, their specials are amazing and the food it's incredible. The seasoning was out of this world and the pasta was perfectly cooked! Definitely I will come back and the attention is flawless.
Very rude and cold staff
Top notch Italian restaurant. Everything we tried was excellent. Staff was friendly and helpful as well. Highly recommend.
Dined here while visiting DC. Food and beer were good.
Great service and food
The bottomless mimosas is the only excuse you need to go to this place. Oh, and the delicious food. Just plan on having a long nap after.
Food was wonderfully presented. Lamb was way over cooked even though I requested it be medium. My friend was happy with her pappardelle. Service was a bit rushed.

Excellent brunch place with creative omelettes, bottomless coffees and mimosas and other tasty a la carte brunch options. Held my own birthday brunch and attended a friends birthday brunch and wasn't disappointed . Food and service are high quality . Hope to check it out for dinner sometime soon!
Absolutely love this place! By far, favorite brunch place in DC. They always fill up your mimosa glasses and the food is superb.
Great food & environment.
Great spot for brunch
Ok

I've always had a fantastic experience at Lavagna. Their weekly specials are amazing! Half priced bottles of wine on Sunday and Tuesday nights, plus happy hour Tuesday- Saturday until 7:00 at the upstairs bar: $4 craft beers, 25% off glasses of wine and $7 cocktails!
Outstanding and great service by Mario!
(Translated by Google) Excellent  (Original) Excelente
Great farm fresh food!
Very good Italian restaurant  food and service
Service and food are both top notch. Excellent wines as well.

Amazing restaurant with great service! Bottomless mimosas for $12 and the pancakes with honey nutella for brunch is the way to go! Outdoor patio also lets you enjoy the natural light with your four legged friend at your side!

The young lady who greeted and seated us, did so with a warm smile. The gentleman who served our food was kind and attentive as well. However, our waiter Chandler was absolutely RUDE. He came to our table exactly three times while visiting the table accross from us at least seven times. He spoke to us while walking away so we never really got complete sentences and he acted as if we were annoying him. I am not one to EVER pull the race card but it was quite evident that his preference (as a caucasian male) was not to serve black people. Our food was pretty good. I enjoyed my mascarpone pancakes. I am certain our experience would have been better if we had someone, (ANYONE) other than Chandler as our waiter.
Great homemade pasta!
A nice little Italian restaurant with a good variety of items on their menu. Their lamb dish was quite good. The texture of the meat was perfect.
I love this place. I've been coming for years and their brunch is amazing. And their half-priced bottle of wine night is one of the best deals you can get.
Had their pancakes and bacon for brunch ... On point. They are not kidding when they say bottomless mimosas either. My glass was never empty.
Great choice for Restaurant Week!
Good concept but salty and pricey. $4 for fresh squeezed orange juice. Home made ketchup was really good.

Brunch was good and not over priced. My carbonara was about $15, homemade, fresh - the best I've had in the city. We also tried the Nutella pancakes which were huge and perfect. The service was quick. Cheap bottomless mimosas -$12, huge glass. I think I had 4-5 fill ups. It was definitely worth it.
The $28 short rib dish served with two spears of asperagus was delicious, but insulting.  Overall good food but very pricy.
This is the first time here for brunch and I really enjoyed the food and service. I am definitely recommending this to anyone I know. Thanks for the experience.
Over priced and the food wasnt that great but service was good. Staff was nice about us changing tables on patio to a shadier spot & accomodating my bfs dog. Patio is too cramped in general though.

We had a few friends in from out of town and wanted to bring them to a great brunch. We had reservations but a loud and mostly drunk birthday party had our table and we could not get seated. However the bartenders made sure we had our unlimited mimosas consistently filled as we waited. Once the host realized we couldn't get seated because of this group, we asked a few bar patrons to scoot down so we could sit our group of 7 at the bar. The bartender, Asia, and the host asked the kitchen to stay open a little longer so we could eat. The bar staff was friendly and got our orders in quickly. As usual the food was great and fresh! Our friends enjoyed their brunch experience. Lavagna is a comfortable setting with a great staff! This place is a must!
Great music, fantastic message
Absolutely love this place im from  Brooklyn checked my bank statement from 2 years ago just to come back . Make sure u do brunch 12$ bottomless for 90mins.
Great food!
Small restaurant. Foods are delicious! Seats are a little bit cramped. Food options on menu are a little limited.
Great food, great atmosphere, $12 bottomless mimosas!!
Excellent. Trust the staff. Get the Ravioli!
Good traditional style pastas. Free bread for the table. Nice atmosphere and good service. The dishes lacked some flavor, though, so I wasn't overly impressed.
This is one of my favorite brunch spots. They have a lot of infused drinks and the poached eggs are always cooked perfectly. You have to try the truffle potatoes.
Fantastic Brunch! Love the local farms. Another delicious brunch chicken and waffles are not to be missed!!
Best duck I have had in a long while. Mario was great!
AMAZING pasta dishes for a reasonable price. They were also able to accommodate our large, loud group upstairs. Absolutely recommend.

Food, service, and knowledgeable wait staff would have us coming back. If you go ask for Torrance. You will not be disappointed with the menu. FABULOUS!!! Thank you Lavaca for a great night of food and drink.
Love this place and Sunday w half price bottles of wine, all the better! Staff is great, food delicious and patio perfect for extending Sunday nights.
Gorgeous place and gorgeous food. Great customer service. Recommend!!
Food was delicious, mussels were a very tasty app! Very friendly and attentive service! I'm considering making this a date night regular spot.
Very nice place to eat at. The food is very tasty, the staff very pleasant and attentive.
(Translated by Google) The whole experience is wonderful from the delicious food, from the knowledge server in Atlanta. Service is also good.  (Original) 整个体验是从美味的食物，从亚特兰大知识服务器的精彩。服务也好.
Great food and dining experience!
Loved our server! Brunch included 90 minutes of mimosas!
Great food.
Very filling brunch with bottomless mimosas.
Food is pasta based cuisine, very flavorful. Limited vegetarian options.
Great food and atmosphere.  Limited menu,  a bit overpriced.  Brussels sprout side was amazing!
Great hand made pasta and classic Italian dishes in DC. Nice wine list, reasonable prices, and large portions. Definitely worth a visit.

The entire experience was wonderful from the delicious food to the knowledge server from Atlanta.  Sorry I forgot her name but she articulated the dishes as if she made them herself.....I can't wait to return.
Impeccable service, delicious menu of house-made pastas - what more could you ask for?
Ask for Mario, tell him I sent you!!!
Excellent Italian food in a pleasant environment
It is a great place for dinner with friends and date.  Good food,  wine and service. Would be nice to have some music
Great service and amazing food! Truly happy with my experience here.

I came from Sydney, Australia to try the brunch menu here and it was amazing! Food was tasty, service was great and the atmosphere was bustling. Would definately fly back here for another visit again! :)
Wonderful cocktails and delicious food. Friendly staff too.
Got seated outside and was totally ignored by the waiter and I finally gave up after 15 mins. The bus staff was nice and filled my water but the waiter just looked thru me and passed by. Racist crap.
The ravioli is amazing!
Half priced bottles of wine on Mondays!

Great brunch. It's one of those places that doesn't have a lot of options on the menu, but anything you order will be really good. They have fresh ingredients and knowledgeable servers who provide good service. Get a reservation!
Solid bottomless!

The food was delicious, but I wouldn't recommend sitting upstairs. It's very noisy, and the service was slow because our server was responsible for too many tables. If you can, sit outside on the patio.
Wonderful, casual neighborhood Italian.

I moved to DC from New Jersey, and while New Jersey doesn't have a lot of strengths when it comes to the food scene, one of the few areas where it excels is Italian. So I go into any Italian experience in DC with fairly high standards.  But Lavagna was a fairly decent meal. I had an excellent pasta dish and some great drinks as well, and the staff were attentive and pleasant the whole meal. I think it's a tiny bit on the pricy side for what you're ultimately getting, but nothing too out of the ordinary for the neighborhood.
Beautiful restaurant and very attentive service. The food was good but too heavy on the cream.
Lavagna is a great hole-in-the-wall Italian restaurant. The wine selection is excellent, and the food is locally sourced and delicious.
Nice place to come and eat, the service was absolutely great. But nothing close to an authentic Italian restaurant.
DELICIOUS!!! I will come back here for dinner anytime I'm in town.
Great spot for Sunday brunch. Friendly staff with great good. Definitely stop by if you're in the Eastern Market area looking for a place to eat.
Wonderful place. Ate out front. Great flavors.  I will be back for seconds. This will be an 8th Street favorite

Lavagna is the place always surprise me: they have best Italian wine in town. The chiefs in that scratch kitchen do have many tricks up their sleeve. From watermelon soup to homemade pasta, all I can say is fantastic! Love the ingredients from local farms! I and my boyfriend enjoy every experience at lavagna. By the way, they have nice private room for events, and I strongly recommend this to everyone. At last, don't miss their brunch too.

We came for brunch and were overall pretty disappointed. For a restaurant that focuses on "scratch" cooking, local, organic, etc, we were surprised to be told that the OJ in the mimosas comes from the soda gun, and was not fresh. I had the arugula omelet and was very disappointed. Not only was it light on flavor, there was almost no cheese in it. Another in my party ordered the goat cheese omelet and it seemed to be better, but had the opposite problem; too much cheese! The potatoes were burnt and the service was not great. On the plus side, the bacon was fantastic, and a very hearty portion for the side order.
Best Italian food in town!  Love the restaurant set up, which reminds you a lots European style.  The food and services are great.  Will definitely recommend Lavagna to anyone.

Went here on Saturday night with a friend and had a great meal. The server was friendly and helpful and made it even more enjoyable. This is a great place for dates, groups, etc. You won't be disappointed.

Would give this 3.5 stars if I could. I came here for brunch and did not go for bottomless mimosas like others have tried. My friend and I both got the Arugula omelet. Both portions were great sizes. However, the ratio of filling vs. egg was not the kind of balance that I normally would want to see. there was a LOT of egg, and very little gouda/arugula/mushroom (I had this added for an additional $1) mix.  Would I come back? Yes. Would I go out of my way to come here again? Probably not.

From the wonderful cocktails to the delicious desserts and everything in between, what a awesome night out. The service was great and personable without being overbearing. The presentation of the dishes and the awesome choices of wine from all over Italy. I couldn't have picked a better spot to go and eat a spot on meal. I had the provolone salad and my woman had the beet salad, both were great, and the slightly seared cheese on my salad was awesome. She had the Bell & Evans chicken dish with these fried Brussels sprouts with bacon and cranberries, WOW! And I had the Bison short rib with a celery root puree and it was just fall off the bone and so very good. We also shared a rigatoni pesto with a house made sausage and WOW WOW to fresh made past and the pesto was amazing. We also shared a great bottle of Barbarossa that had everything going down perfectly. Even though we had very little room left to eat dessert, we chose to have a couple after dinner drinks, she had port and I had a Basil Hayden neat with this chocolate pudding that we had to finish because it was so dam good.  Great experience and we will be back here many times. It is a place you can take a first date or just go to grab a quick bite. Nice ambiance and FRANK playing to sooth the ear drums. I was told they have an awesome happy hour and fun bar upstairs. We will be going on day for happy hour and definitely for dinner again soon.

LARGE PARTIES AVOID THIS RESTAURANT!!! So extremely disappointed with the service.  Good luck if you happened to get Marge, she will ruin your night!  In my 20 years dining out I’ve never had such horrible service! If you have a party of 5 or more please AVOID this venue. Since the tip was included my server code: Marge didn’t think it was important to serve us. We spent close to $400 between the 6 of us and the only time we saw Marge was when we tracked her down. Any time we needed to replenish our water or our cocktails, we had to flag her down. Again the tip was included so Marge wasn’t really worried.  Since there were so many different choices, it took my sister a few more minutes to order. Of course, Marge is too cool to recommend any plates. After her going back and forth with what entrée she wanted to order, here comes Marge with a whole a lot of attitude, “pick any thing at all.” Come on!!! After waiting for 22 minutes to order our desert course, I had to get her attention, again, when I told her we were ready for desert; her exact words were “I know how this works, I’ve been doing this for a few years.”  Not only that, she put my wife’s plate into my half eaten food. Didn’t even ask if I wanted to bag it to go. In fact, after she put her (my wife’s) plate into mine, my wife had to speak up and tell her to bag her food… She didn’t say a word once we were done with our desert, Marge just came by and put the bill in the middle of the table and walked away.
Our pastas were incredible.

Top notch bottomless brunch, solid local food.  After experiencing many bottomless brunches around town, Lavanga may edge them all out.  $12 gets you unlimited mimosa in a very large wine glass and their servers are so attentive it never runs dry. The mimosas themselves are delicious too. The add triple sec into the mix for a sweeter taste. They also have house infused vodkas for bloody Mary's.  The food is also solid. The risotto dishes and brussel sprouts are some of the best. The menus alters through the year featuring seasonal staples and sprucing up existing dishes.  Steve, the owner, is also likely to greet you when you arrive and personally check on your table.

I came here just after they opened and I was not impressed by the prices nor quality of the food. The "hand made" pasta was mushy and cold. The sauce might as well ave been ragu. There's better Italian across the street.
Did brunch here. It was good. But not enough to motivate me to try dinner.

Nice spot with everything fresh, local and made in house - even the pasta! Everyone really enjoyed their meal and the Carbonara was to die for! The portions were generous but I still managed to devour it at an embarrassingly fast pace. I will definitely be back for brunch soon! A true gem tucked away on 8th St SE!

had chicken and waffles at Sunday brunch. chicken was juicy and very flavorful - crispy honey fried skin. waffles were weak - 2 tiny triangles that were very dry and not a lot of flavor. the dish came with a side of fruit - it was no good - watermelon, cantaloupe, pineapple all seemed out of season and lacked that sweet fresh fruit taste. the portion size was ok. overall, a decent brunch spot - but not memorable enough for me to come back for brunch. Rock n Roll Hotel's brunch chicken n waffles on their rooftop is still my favorite.

What a gem! I really felt like I was back in Italy while enjoying my time here. Our server was wonderful, attentive and knowledgable about all the specials. The cuisine was on point and very flavorful. I can't wait to go back!

I did come back anf tried pasta. Pasta was good but vegie ingridients were not fresh and replaced. I guess no more  desire to come back here again. Service was not this good either this time for the price of a dish.
Wonderful experience!!  Happily accommodated our vegetarianism with an off the charts creation!  Highly recommend!!

Place was absolutely delicious. After reading some of the reviews I was a little skeptical but I really wanted Italian for dinner.  My wife and I ate some of the best homemade pasta we have ever had. We wanted to lick the plate it was so good. Also, read somewhere it was expensive but honestly all of the pasta dishes were under 20 bucks which is better than an Olive Garden. If you want wine it can be pricy.  All an all it really is worth trying if you are in DC for a reasonably priced Italian meal.

This place looked very appealing at first glance so we decided to have dinner here. Food was good but, little pricey. No problem but the first server we had changed out after we placed our food order and the new server was  extremely rude and pushy. They told us we "can smoke as long as we sat on one of the outside tables". As we finished our meal and lit up a smoke while drinking our $60 bottle of wine. The manager abruptly approached the table and rudely informed us that we "can't f**king smoke here" and that we need to leave after spending over $200 and getting a $100 parking ticket due to the serving staff telling us that we "could park in front of the restaurant as long as were eating there". No compensation much less an appology for the false information was remotely considered. When they took our credit card  payment which was $50 more than our reciept, then reluctantly fixed the error and offered nothing to suggest that it was unintensional. In summary the food is good not amazing, and overpriced. the staff is rude and illinformed as to their own policies and seemingly attempted to over charge us. There are hundreds of places to eat fine dinning in D.C. please dont waste your money and experience in this psuedo fancy place.
